text: Recently , tumor suppressors <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were shown to regulate the apoptosis of glioblastoma cells ( Chiang et al . , 2012 ) .

<extra_id_0> WW domain-containing oxidoreductase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , known as <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> FOR <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , or <extra_id_0> WOX1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , is encoded by human or mouse <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> Wwox <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
This gene is located in chromosome 16q23.3-24.1 , an area known as the common fragile site FRA16D .

The full-length <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein is composed of two N-terminal WW domains , a C-terminal short-chain alcohol dehydrogenase / reductase ( SDR ) domain , and a proapoptotic C-terminal tail D3 ( Chang et al . , 2001 , 2007 , 2010 ; Aqeilan et al . , 2004 , 2007 ; Hong et al . , 2007 ; Salah et al . , 2012 ) ( Figure 1 ) .

<extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may act as an alternative receptor for sex steroid hormones , since its SDR domain possesses an NSYK motif capable of interacting with androgen and estrogen ( Chang et al . , 2005a ; Su et al . , 2012 ) .

Expression of <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is either altered or lost from epigenetic modification in multiple malignant cancers , such as non-small cell lung carcinoma ( Donati et al . , 2007 ) , hematopoietic malignancies ( Ishii and Furukawa , 2004 ) , gastric carcinoma ( Aqeilan et al . , 2004 ) , pancreatic carcinoma ( Kuroki et al . , 2004 ) , breast carcinoma ( Guler et al . , 2004 ; Aqeilan et al . , 2007 ) , and glioblastoma multiforme ( Kosla et al . , 2011 ) .

Restoration of <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene prevents the growth of lung cancer ( Fabbri et al . , 2005 ) , pancreatic cancer ( Nakayama et al . , 2008 ) , and prostate cancer ( Hong et al . , 2009 ) .

The first WW domain of <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may interact with proteins possessing a PPxY motif ( s ) such as <extra_id_0> AP-2gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p73 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> ErbB4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Ezrin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> SIMPLE <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> RUNX4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and many others ( Chang et al . , 2007 ; Salah et al . , 2012 ; Su et al . , 2012 ; Figure 1 ) .

Transiently overexpressed <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds transcription factors <extra_id_0> AP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p73 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and block their nuclear relocation in vitro , which suppresses cancer cell survival ( Salah et al . , 2012 ) .

In stark contrast , <extra_id_0> Wwox <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> co-migrates with proapoptotic and pro-survival transcription factors to the nuclei of neurons upon sciatic nerve axotomy in rats ( Li et al . , 2009 ) .
No blocking of translocation of transcription factors to the nuclei by <extra_id_0> Wwox <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was observed .

Under stress conditions , <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is activated via phosphorylation at Tyr33 , and binds proteins independently of the PPxY motif ( Chang et al . , 2001 , 2003 , 2005a , b , 2007 , 2010 ) .

Activated <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> physically interacts with serine 46 - phosphorylated <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Figure 1 ) , which stabilizes <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and its apoptotic function ( Chang et al . , 2005b ) .

Also , <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds Disheveled proteins ( Dvl ) , which are key components in Wnt / <extra_id_0> beta-catenin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathway ( Figure 1 ) .
No PPxY motif is in Dvl .

Transiently overexpressed <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sequesters <extra_id_0> Dvl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the cytoplasm and thereby blocks <extra_id_0> Dvl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated TCF transcriptional activity ( Bouteille et al . , 2009 ) .

Overexpressed <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces apoptosis and inhibits proliferation of human hepatic carcinoma cells ( Hu et al . , 2012 ) and many cancer cell types ( Chang et al . , 2007 , 2010 ; Salah et al . , 2012 ; Su et al . , 2012 ) .

<extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> enhances the cytotoxic function of <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by down-regulating apoptosis inhibitor <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Bcl-xL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and up - regulating apoptotic <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Chang et al . , 2001 ) .
Also , <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mediates cell death synergistically with <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Upon exposure to chemicals or environmental stress , such as UV irradiation and chemotherapeutic drugs , <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> undergoes phosphorylation in Tyr33 and probably others sites , followed by relocating to mitochondria or nuclei for inducing apoptosis ( Chang et al . , 2007 , 2010 ) .
<extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds MEK in Jurkat T cells ( Lin et al . , 2011 ) .

Phorbol myristate acetate ( PMA ) dissociates the MEK / WWOX complex and induces <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to translocate to the mitochondria to induce apoptosis , whereas MEK relocates to the lipid raft .
Inhibition of MEK activity increases TMZ - induced suppression of cancer cell growth ( Holt et al . , 2012 ) .

Ectopic expression of <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in A549 cells induces <extra_id_0> procaspase-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> procaspase-9 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation and induces cytochrome C releasing from the mitochondria ( Zhang et al . , 2012a ) .

Complement C1q induces ectopic <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation in Try33 and leads to cell apoptosis independently of the classical complement activation pathway ( Hong et al . , 2009 ) .

A portion of <extra_id_0> WWOX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is anchored in the membrane / cytoskeleton area via binding with hyaluronidase <extra_id_0> Hyal-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Hsu et al . , 2009 ) and Phospho - <extra_id_0> Ezrin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Jin et al . , 2006 ) .

<extra_id_0> Transforming growth factor beta1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binds <extra_id_0> Hyal-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as a cognate receptor to signal the formation of the WWOX / Hyal-2 / Smad4 complex to relocate to the nucleus for enhancing the SMAD - driven promoter activity ( Hsu et al . , 2009 ) .
